name: Go Big Green
notes: I don't know why people think 0 and 00 are magical numbers. This system would perform the same as betting on 31 and 32 over time.

name: Rack 'em & Stack 'em

name: Lever Up
notes: You're supposed to bet on a 'sector' of the wheel and Martingale (double-up) after 3 losses. They lost count two times and flat bet when they should have doubled down.

spins.notes: Lauren was supposed to double up for this spin, but she didn't. They should have won $260 here.
Lauren was supposed to double up for this spin, but she didn't. They should have won $260 here.

name: Pendulum
notes: This system involves switching dozens/columns but the betting scheme only picks one combination of the two dozens bet on. The payouts should be similar for different dozens. You basically win 1 unit for hitting, lose 2 units when you miss. Alex gave this a Plum. Lauren gave it an Eggplant.

name: Peach Cobbler
notes: Alex was up $895 at the end, but he should have been up $900. There is no payout that ends with anything but a zero.

spins.notes: Alex shifted the double-street bets down to expose 1-6 for this spin.
Alex kept the shift on, so the number 4 was exposed.
Alex went with betting scheme #2 with the straight-up, split, street, corner, and double-street bets for this spin.
Alex deviates from the system and just starts betting with config #2 here. They also bought in for more a few times.
Alex hit a double-street here.

name: EZ MOJO
notes: Make a 'ghost' spin and pick the opposite color for the middle dozen. They spun black, so they chose red for the middle section and then alternate between red/black on every spin.

name: Self Assessment
notes: 4 Whacks, win $5 on everything else.

spins.notes: Lauren bet on the wrong column, and Alex corrected the bet after the ball landed.

name: Lucky Sections

name: Tie Advanced
notes: 'Advanced Tie Fighter' system

name: Diamond Cross
notes: Alex gave it a 'Plum+'. I give it an F because you're betting on 36 numbers, which is a huge no-no. Of your $260 bet, over $150 of the money cancels itself out.

name: Rated T
notes: Lucky Lauren at the helm, Alex dealing. They had to add $1000 to the buy-in to cover the bet on Spin 6. It's absolutely idiotic that this betting progression can't even stand to make the max bet off the bat without buying in for more money. I'm really not a fan of Lauren just 'getting a loan from the casino' when she needed to cover the bet. System ratings should be based on how the system would perform in the real world.

name: Dirty Bird
notes: David rated this as a Grapefruit. Lauren rated it as a Peach.

name: EXTENZE

name: Discount Tickets to the Streets
notes: In this system, you need to win 4 in a row before you can 'coast' with 5 Double Street bets. The problem is David is never able to hit that threshold, so the system just drains his bankroll.
